Package nl.han.ica.oopg.engine

Class GameEngine

java.lang.Object
java.awt.Component
java.awt.Container
java.awt.Panel
java.applet.Applet
processing.core.PApplet
nl.han.ica.oopg.engine.GameEngine
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.event.FocusListener, java.awt.event.KeyListener, java.awt.event.MouseListener, java.awt.event.MouseMotionListener, java.awt.event.MouseWheelListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Runnable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible, processing.core.PConstants
Direct Known Subclasses:
IntoTheGalaxy
public abstract class GameEngine
extends processing.core.PApplet
GameEngine is the core of the game. Extending this class is required to make use of the GameEngine.

This engine is created by: Bram Heijmink, Jeffrey Haen, Joost Elshof, Kenny Ligthart, Mark Vaesen and Nico Smolders.

See Also:

    • setup

      public void setup()
      The actual setup of the game-engine. Used to make sure the gameThread is started after setup has finished. This method is invoked by processing.

    • deleteAllGameObjectsOfType

      public <T extends GameObject> void deleteAllGameObjectsOfType​(java.lang.Class<T> type)
      Delete all GameObjects of a given type from the GameEngine.

      Example paramater: Player.class

      Type Parameters:
      T - Generic type, should extend GameObject
      Parameters:
      type - The type of the gameobjects

    • updateGame

      public void updateGame()
      Updates every GameObject inside the GameEngine. Calls move method and checks for collision.

      This method is called by the GameThread.

    • update

      public abstract void update()
      Implement this method to make constant updates in your game

      PApplet.mouseDragged()

    • setGameSpeed

      public void setGameSpeed​(int updatesPerSecond) throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
      Sets the amount of updates per second for the GameThread.
      Parameters:
      updatesPerSecond - The number of udates per second
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the updatesPerSecond is smaller than 1

    • calculateRelativeMouseLocation

      public processing.core.PVector calculateRelativeMouseLocation​(int x, int y)
      Gets and calculates the relative mouse position with the location of world (TileMap). A negative value means the mouse position is detected outside the world map.
      Parameters:
      x - The x coordinate
      y - The y coordinate
      Returns:
      PVector
